entry.title: What is an Outlier? Definition and How to Find Outliers in Statistics
entry.summary: Outliers are an important part of a dataset. They can hold useful information about your data. Outliers can give helpful insights into the data you're studying, and they can have an effect on statistical results. This can potentially help you disover inconsistencies and detect any errors in your statistical processes.

entry.title: Introduction to the Solid JavaScript Library
entry.summary: Solid is a reactive JavaScript library for creating user interfaces without a virtual DOM. entry.title: How To Develop Your Businessâ€™ Technology Roadmap
entry.summary: Software development without a roadmap is akin to driving off a cliff â€” an undertaking that seriously jeopardizes your productâ€™s life. Hereâ€™s how to develop a business technology roadmap that ensures your project safely reaches its final destination.

entry.title: Useful Figma Plugins And Tools
entry.summary: Useful Figma plugins that will help you fix all the little slowdowns and boost your productivity. From color management and image assets to SVG shapes and animation. Thatâ€™s our new guide to Figma.

entry.title: New Smashing Workshops on Front-End & Design
entry.summary: How do we build and establish a successful, bulletproof design system? Whatâ€™s the state of HTML Email? And what are new, smart interface design patterns we could use? Letâ€™s find out. With our [brand new online workshops](https://smashingconf.com/online-workshops/) on front-end & design â€” to help us all boost skills online.

entry.title: Handling Mounting And Unmounting Of Navigation Routes In React Native
entry.summary: Often you need two different sets of navigation stacks for pre and post user authentication. Usually, to see more content, you have to be authenticated in some way. Letâ€™s look at how to mount and unmount navigation stack based on a met condition in React Native.

entry.title: Cookieless Alternative To Embed HTML, CSS And JS Code Snippets
entry.summary: Embedding code examples with third-party scripts often leads to tracking or cookies. We always wanted to have a simple website with a good UX, so setting cookies for no reason wasnâ€™t an option for us. Now, with Indiepen, we are proud to introduce a privacy-friendly alternative.

entry.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 41 With Eva PenzeyMoog: Designing For Safety
entry.summary: In this episode, weâ€™re talking about designing for safety. What does it mean to consider vulnerable users in our designs? Drew McLellan talks to expert Eva PenzeyMoog to find out.

entry.title: HTTP/3 From A To Z: Core Concepts (Part 1)
entry.summary: What exactly is HTTP/3? Why was it needed so soon after HTTP/2 (which was only finalized in 2015)? How can or should you use it? And especially, how does this improve web performance? Letâ€™s find out.

entry.title: Four Useful VSCode Extensions For Web Developers
entry.summary: VS Code can be supercharged wuth hundreds of [VS Code extensions](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/05/useful-vs-code-extensions-web-developers/). In this article, Leonardo shares four useful extensions that help him in his daily work.

entry.title: Frustrating Design Patterns: Disabled Buttons
entry.summary: How can we make disabled buttons more inclusive? When do they work well, and when do they fail on us? And finally, when do we actually need them, and how can we avoid them? Letâ€™s find out.

entry.title: React Children And Iteration Methods
entry.summary: In this article, weâ€™ll discuss and learn about the use case of iterating over React `children` and the ways to do it. In particular, we will deep dive into one of the utility methods, `React.Children.toArray`, that React gives us, which helps to iterate over the children in a way which ensures performance and determinism.

entry.title: How To Build Resilient JavaScript UIs
entry.summary: Resilience is intrinsic to the web and therefore us, web developers. This article explores how graceful degradation, defensive coding, observability, and a healthy attitude towards failures better equips us before, during, and after an error occurs.

entry.title: Refactoring CSS: Strategy, Regression Testing And Maintenance (Part 2)
entry.summary: In this article, weâ€™ll take a deep dive into the refactoring process itself, and cover incremental refactoring strategy, visual regression testing, and maintaining the refactored codebase.

entry.title: Good Vibes In August (2021 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)
entry.summary: New month, new wallpapers! In this post, youâ€™ll find unique and inspiring wallpapers for August 2021. Created with love by the community for the community, they come in versions with and without a calendar for the month.

entry.title: How To Build An E-Commerce Site With Angular 11, Commerce Layer And Paypal
entry.summary: Having an e-commerce store is crucial for any store owner as more and more customers are turning to online shopping. In this tutorial, we shall go through how to create an e-commerce site with Angular 11. The site will use the Commerce Layer as a headless e-commerce API and use Paypal to process payments.

entry.title: There Is No Such Thing As A CSS Absolute Unit
entry.summary: What are absolute units? What are the differences between relative and absolute units, and how do we create accurate sizes on the web? In this article, Elad Shechter explains why CSS absolute units arenâ€™t so absolute.

entry.title: Creating An Accessible Dialog From Scratch
entry.summary: Dialogs are everywhere in modern interface design (for good or for bad), and yet many of them are not accessible to assistive technologies. In this article, we will dig into how to create a short script to create accessible dialogs.
